text: Does anyone know if it’s possible to run Julia in Heroku in a docker container? It would make sense as they support docker, but I have very little knowledge of Heroku, so I’m not sure. The underlying reason for the question is this: <https://www.heroku.com/connect>

attachments.title: Heroku Connect & Salesforce Data Sync | Heroku
attachments.text: Heroku Connect makes it easy to build apps on the Heroku platform and sync data with your Salesforce deployment and Heroku Postgres. Use Heroku Shield Connect to build high compliance apps.
attachments.fallback: Heroku Connect & Salesforce Data Sync | Heroku

elements.text: Does anyone know if it’s possible to run Julia in Heroku in a docker container? It would make sense as they support docker, but I have very little knowledge of Heroku, so I’m not sure. The underlying reason for the question is this:

text: <https://covid-county-dash.herokuapp.com/> is a Julia app running in Heroku, so it's definitely possible :stuck_out_tongue:.
